profile_positions.description: Heading up a team based in Rotterdam (Netherlands) and Algeciras (Spain) responsible for planning all container (empty and full) flows between Europe to the Middle East, Indian Subcontinent and Africa. With a clear ambition to deliver on what we have promised to our customers, our team is constantly searching for optimizing and improving the end to end delivery success ratio for our customers.
profile_positions.title: Head of Ocean Fulfilment for Africa and Middle East Trades

profile_positions.description:
As being part of the Northern European operational head office for Maersk Line, responsible for all water side cargo operations for Maersk Line container business to and from our oceangoing vessels. 
I am heading up a team of 10 FTE in Rotterdam, which works partly 24/7. Next to that I am responsible for the execution of the off shored cargo operations tasks which on our behalf are executed in Mumbai, India. 
Main focus of the cargo operations team is to reduce dwell time of containers by pro-actively mitigate operational errors, reduce cost by faster and more accurate information sharing with our container terminals and to be the link between the Maersk Line commercial organization and the container terminals. 
As being the last link in a long end to end Maersk Line process chain in a hectic operational environment, the Cargo Operations team often needs to make fast and high impacting decisions without having all the details of the potential impact on the table. It lies in the experience of the team, but even more in standardized decision taking across the team to minimize the operational and commercial impact of such decisions. Communication to both our internal and external stakeholders is key in this process.
profile_positions.title: Head of Cargo Operations

profile_positions.description:
Lead a team of 6 FTE which is responsible for the network execution of the Feeder network in the Baltic, Finland and Russia region.
The team is responsible to maximize utilization of the assets (vessel capacity) available in the region, reduce the behavioral cost in our ports and maintain high reliability within the network. The region has high volatility on volumes and is during the long winter months vulnerable due to the challenging weather conditions (ice and wind). These 2 factors create a ever changing environment in which the team needs to use creativity and perseverance the execute the network at the highest utilization and lowest cost.
profile_positions.title: Manager Feeder Execution

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for improving the productivity & efficiency for all ports/terminals operated with the Northern European scope of the centralized operations center. Focus to improve, standardize and align the interactions Maersk Line has with all it's end to end partners on terminal operations with the aim to reduce the vessel turn around within the ports. 
During these 2 years visited all major container terminals in North Europe (for Maersk Line) to complete a diagnostic visit in which improvement potential was identified. Responsible to ensure that a team of 6 persons implemented and sustained the improvement ideas identified.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Terminal and Port efficiency

profile_positions.description: Project Management Office in project pilot, with a focus on internal End to End processes within Maersk Line. Responisble to set standards on terminal impacting processes.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Terminal and Port efficiency

profile_positions.description: Expatriated as single implant on behalf of our Rotterdam office to facilitate and implement standardized operational tasks (equal to 16 FTE) into the back office in Mumbai, India. All standardized tasks moved from Rotterdam to Mumbai as well as a more pro-active and flexible way of working was introduced in the back office.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager offshoring

profile_positions.description:
The Central Europe operations center expanded geographical scope during this period from 3 countries(Netherlands, Belgium and Germany) to complete North Europe, starting from France up to St. Petersburg, Russia (including Great Britain and Scandinavia). I was largely responsible to migrate the tasks from the existing offices in those countries to the Rotterdam office, by mapping, standardizing and implementing these tasks. 
Also a large number of new IT systems were to be implemented in the operations center, where i was responsible partially for the development of systems as well as the implementation.
profile_positions.title: Supervisor Projects Department

profile_positions.description: Part of the Cargo Control team for Maersk Line, where we were responsible for consolidating, checking and sending the load and discharge instructions for the Maersk Line vessel within our geographical scope. Middle man between the commercial side of the company and our container terminals.
profile_positions.title: administrative employee
